subject: Automobile Racing
Frauds and Swindling
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Gene Haas, the 54-year-old owner of Haas Automation and Nascar’s Haas CNC Racing, was sentenced to two years in federal prison after he pleaded guilty to defrauding the government of more than $34 million in taxes. As part of his plea agreement, Haas paid a $5 million fine, and more than $70 million in back taxes and interest. He pleaded guilty in August to a felony conspiracy charge for orchestrating a plan to list bogus expenses that could be written off as business costs and save Haas Automation millions in taxes. The company makes computerized machine tools.
